trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for Android apps (JavaScript backend)
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for Android apps (JavaScript backend)

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Android development (JavaScript backend).
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Android development (JavaScript backend).

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services for Android (JavaScript backend)
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services for Android (JavaScript backend)

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an Android app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an Android app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple **To do list** app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple **To do list** app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial requires the [Android Developer Tools](https://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html)), which includes the Android Studio integrated development environment, and the latest Android platform.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial requires the [Android Developer Tools](https://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html)), which includes the Android Studio integrated development environment, and the latest Android platform.

trans-unit.source: Android 4.2 or a later version is required.
trans-unit.target: Android 4.2 or a later version is required.

trans-unit.source: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Azure Mobile Services SDK for Android.
trans-unit.target: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Azure Mobile Services SDK for Android.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28).

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Create a new Android app
trans-unit.target: Create a new Android app

trans-unit.source: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Azure classic portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Azure classic portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create a new Android app that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create a new Android app that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure classic portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure classic portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click **Android** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Android app**.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click **Android** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Android app**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the three easy steps to create an Android app connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This displays the three easy steps to create an Android app connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install the [Android Developer Tools](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=280125) on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install the [Android Developer Tools](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=280125) on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.

trans-unit.source: Now download your app by pressing the **Download** button.
trans-unit.target: Now download your app by pressing the **Download** button.

trans-unit.source: Run your Android app
trans-unit.target: Run your Android app

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with data]
Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with data]
Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
